title: Connecting Asian Voters & Proposers
description: 言葉の違いや文化的排他性により、投票に必要な情報が信頼できないなどの障壁があります。

f6_assessments.q0: Establishing the Eastern Townhall and translating content (also proposals) into major Asian languages is definitely helping to become a more inclusive community. I experienced this also in my work for a globel company, that this is important. We might need to experiment along this journey, how deep we can go with localization (there might be a limit due to the speed in which new content is created and due to the high effort behind translations - AI might help us here in the future).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are the very core-team behind Catalyst Swarm, Eastern Townhall, Catalyst School, most of them IT & software engineers and educators. I see very little risk to fail, since the Eastern Townhall format is already successfully growing.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has provided some reasonable KPIs for measuring and reporting success. What might be a bit critical is to handle 'success' of such ongoing services in the longer term. According to my professional experience, user participation and user satisfaction will be driven by multiple initiatives - we will see how we can avoid debates about who drives which KPI to what extent. Would have been nice to find some reflections about how to handle this within the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal was to provide trusted information by meeting people where they are, in their local language and culture which effectively addresses the challenge. The proposal is seeking funds to help develop a program specifically designed to help connect voters with proposals and proposers.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposers are co-Founders of Catalyst Swarm, Eastern Townhall, Catalyst School. IT & Software Engineering. educators and accountant in East Asia & Japan which is very capable on implementing the proposal. The plan's initial objective is simple: to get a lot of existing Cardano and Catalyst material translated into as many languages of the East and Southeast Asian regions using a semi-automated system. Gaining experience and building community.
f6_assessments.q2: The key performance indicators (KPIs) are well thought-out, and the timeline is reasonable. The ability to audit will come from Github activity and engagement section.

f6_assessments.q0:
the proposal address the challenge effectively:

1. they estimate to increase the number of voters, based on the questionnaire performed by them
2. the budget is reasonable, given the team and the aim
3. there is multiple tasks performed and planned
f6_assessments.q1: detailed description of the large team is provided. I assess the likelihood of the success to be high.
f6_assessments.q2: a very detailed key metrics were provided, which can serve as a base for auditing the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: It addresses several really significant issues that are absolutely key to this challenge. I particularly like that although its initial focus is languages, this proposal goes further, and addresses cultural exclusivity, making new concepts accessible, and tackling information overload. It addresses these issues effectively because the proposed solution is a joined-up approach, rather than addressing individual issues piecemeal. I particularly like the way that user research is embedded throughout, rather than tacked on as an afterthought – this feels important, because if we're truly going to address these issues, it's crucial to listen to users.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team clearly have the skills, range, and embedded-ness in their communities to implement the proposal really well. Also the team's diversity feels like an example of the proposal in action, which is good to see.
The timeline and milestones look ambitious but do-able; and the budget looks good and is really well thought out.
Also, good to see intellectual property being addressed in a proposal; and to see the roles of the team so clearly defined. 
If I have one suggestion for improvement, it would be to include a brief risk assessment. Clearly the team are aware of the risks and how to mitigate them, but the information is embedded in several parts of the proposal and it would be good to have it pulled together.
But overall the thoroughness of the proposal makes it highly likely that it will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The outputs are well defined, measurable, and are set out as a very clear roadmap, so we can audit ongoing progress, as well as final outcomes.
There is a good mix of quantitative and qualitative in the metrics that are being measured, which means we get a full picture of what has been achieved. And the metrics being measured actually do relate to the original problem statement (something not all projects manage to do!) so we can audit whether the project is addressing the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal fits well with what this challenge seeks and also with the Multilingual Resources challenge. Breaking the linguistic and cultural barriers between most of the Cardano ecosystem and the natives of Asia is indeed contributing to collective decision-making, since it will more satisfactorily address a considerable portion of our community members. In addition, the authors propose to create a series of activities, which together will form the "Eastern Townhall Forum", which, in addition to the translation of content, will engage the holders of ada from the eastern world. Thus, the objectives of the challenge would be met, because movement among the Asian members of the ecosystem would certainly favor distributed decision-making.
f6_assessments.q1: O time que compõe os autores dessa proposta é certamente forte. São diversos profissionais, provenientes de variadas localidades e detentores de diferentes saberes, desde especialistas em blockchain até engenheiros de sotfware. É muito positivo que eles tenha incluindo uma breve, porém direta descrição do que cada faz, aonde trabalha/já trabalhou e etc; eu acho sempre muito bom quando perfis do linkedin são inclusos, para podermos dar uma olhada mais detalhada na trajetória de cada, mas a descrição aqui inclusa é também muito válida. Além disso, achei importante eles esclarecerem que trabalham de forma consensual, pelo o que eu entendi, não há um líder, o que dialoga muito bem com o funcionamento geral do nosso ecossistema.
f6_assessments.q2: A auditabilidade dessa proposta está excelente, contendo todos os requisitos necessários para entendermos como acontecerá, na prática, esse projeto. Temos listados tópicos do que acontecerá, em determinado período de tempo, controlado em meses; também nos é detalhado como o dinheiro pedido no financiamento seria dividido, além de métricas de sucesso, que ajudaria a comunidade a acompanhar o andamento das coisas. Também são definidos os objetivos principais do projeto, fazendo com que nós avaliadores possamos entender muito bem os anseios do time. Dessa maneira, temos uma visão detalhada e segura de tudo que acontecerá, não achei pontos a criticar ou senti falta de alguma coisa nessa proposta, está tudo perfeito.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to both collect valuable and public insights needed for this challenge in the future and to improve information available to voters across Asia on the short term. By doing so it is improving the decision making of a large audiance. The team already has an existing platform to ensure the efforts will reach their audiance, as well.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team consists of active members from across Asia who have come together and started an Eastern Town Hall addition to the exisitng Catalyst Town Hall. Due to the size of the team and their previous engagement it is highly likely that the milestones will be achieved. The work is in line with work that is already being done. 
The budget could have some more detail, it is not entirely clear how the budget relates to the roadmap/milestones. The reason for not giving a lower score because of this, is that the teams previous effort should be enough to earn our trust that they will deliver even if the budget runs out. The scope is also very reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: There are a reasonable amount of metrics mentioned which would help track the overall engagement with the Eastern Town hall. However, it is not exactly clear how some of the metrics would be measured. How will the origin of voters and Ideascale members be determined? At the same time, the surveys which are part of the proposal should provide some insights here, therefor the overall auditability seems adequate
